summary: This document is an email chain from November 2019 between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an Assistant United States Attorney. Barket, representing Nicholas Tartaglione (Jeffrey Epstein's former cellmate), offers information from Tartaglione to rebut theories that Epstein was murdered and to support that he was suicidal, including details about Epstein's suicide attempt and the conduct of prison staff. The prosecution declines the interview offer.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione; initiates email correspondence with the U.S. Attorney's Office to offer information from his client regarding Jeffrey Epstein's state of mind and prison conditions.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center; possesses firsthand information about Epstein's suicide attempt on July 22-23, 2019, and observations about prison staff conduct.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and sex offender; the subject of the correspondence regarding the circumstances of his suicide attempt and death while in federal custody.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Bruce Barket; likely a colleague or legal staff involved in the case.

persons.name: Donna Aldea
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Bruce Barket; likely a colleague or legal staff at Barket's law firm.

connections.description: Bruce Barket identifies himself as the attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione.
Tartaglione was a cellmate with Jeffrey Epstein in prison until Epstein's suicide attempt.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's attempted suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, during which Nicholas Tartaglione was his cellmate.

events.title: Attorney Offer of Information
events.description: Bruce Barket emails the U.S. Attorney's Office offering information from his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, regarding Epstein's suicide attempt and prison conditions.

events.title: Prosecution Declines Interview
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney replies to Bruce Barket, stating they do not anticipate interviewing Nicholas Tartaglione.

locations: Garden City, NY 11530 (Location of Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP)
New York, New York 10007 (Location of the United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (Implied location of Epstein and Tartaglione's incarceration)
keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the time of Epstein's suicide attempt on July 22-23, 2019.
Defense attorney Bruce Barket claimed Tartaglione possessed information to rebut murder theories and support the conclusion Epstein was suicidal.
Tartaglione also had information about the conduct of prison staff around the time of both Epstein's suicide attempt and his actual death.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York declined the offer to interview Tartaglione in November 2019.
The correspondence reveals a legal effort to provide witness testimony about Epstein's state of mind and prison conditions shortly after his death.
